fr.sorbonne_u.cps.dht_mapreduce.interfaces.endpoints

Interface ContentNodeBaseCompositeEndPointI<CAI extends ContentAccessSyncI,MRI extends MapReduceSyncI>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.endpoints.AbstractEndPointI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.endpoints.CompositeEndPointI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ContentNodeAsyncCompositeEndPointI<CAI,MRI>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    POJOContentNodeCompositeEndPoint

    public interface ContentNodeBaseCompositeEndPointI<CAI extends ContentAccessSyncI,MRI extends MapReduceSyncI>
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.endpoints.CompositeEndPointI
    The interface ContentNodeBaseCompositeEndPointI defines the signatures of methods that a composite of several end points connecting a client to a server implementation of a content node in the distributed hash table must provide.

    Description

    A content node has two connection points, or end points, corresponding to two interfaces that a server provides through the composite: a content access interface for adding, getting and removing data from the DHT and map/reduce interface for performing data-wise computations. The composite end point, used to facilitate the connections among clients of these end points and nodes providing them in the DHT, allows to retrieve each simple end points (of type EndPointI) for each of the interfaces provided through these end points in the composite.

    The signatures in this interface also specialise signatures declared in CompositeEndPointI to the types used in DHT nodes. The signature copyWithSharable is added merely to specialise the return type of the overwritten signature from CompositeEndPointI with the hereby defined interface. Doing this avoids class casts in the code using this signature.

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2024-06-24

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
